doc.previous: Physiological death is now seen as a process more than an event conditions once considered indicative of death are now reversible 5 Where in the process a dividing line is drawn between life and death depends on factors beyond the presence or absence of vital signs In general clinical death is neither necessary nor sufficient for a determination of legal death A patient with working heart and lungs determined to be brain dead can be pronounced legally dead without clinical death occurring As scientific knowledge and medicine advance a precise medical definition of death becomes more problematic 6
doc.after: Signs of death or strong indications that a warm blooded animal is no longer alive are
